Content:
Legalization
The shipper can obtain a certified Certificate of Origin and Invoice from the Saudi Embassy or Chamber of Commerce prior to export to assist with clearance in Saudi Arabia.
Paperless Invoice - Imports
UPS Paperless Invoice is accepted by Customs for small package imports.
Miscellaneous
IECEE permit/SASO
Commodities requiring SASO/IECEE: Electrical goods, water pumps, washing machines, laptops, printers, mobile phones, batteries. 3-pin power cords required (2-pin not allowed).
Saber/SASO
Saber platform registers conformity certificates for consumer products. Check https://saber.sa/home/regulations.
Certificate of Origin
Required if origin is removable (e.g., sticker); not needed if permanently marked. SFDA, CITC, MOI may still request it. Chamber of Commerce issuance is enough; Saudi Embassy certification optional. Guarantee letter allows 90 days to provide docs or face a 2000 SAR ($533 USD) penalty.
MSDS-NON DG
IATA A67 goods (e.g., batteries) need an MSDS—UAE transits may delay without it.
Certificate of Conformity
SASO CoC required for mobiles, computers, telecom equipment, and appliances—must be lab-tested and accompany shipment.
Info About Section Header: This section explains the paperwork needed when bringing goods into Saudi Arabia, including certificates, permits, and other requirements.
Simplified Form: - *Legalized Docs*: Get a Certificate of Origin and Invoice certified by the Chamber of Commerce or Saudi Embassy before shipping.
- *Paperless Invoice*: UPS Paperless works for small package imports.
- *SASO/IECEE*: Electrical items (e.g., laptops, phones) need a SASO cert and 3-pin cords—importer needs an IECEE permit for 3+ items.
- *Saber Platform*: Register consumer goods on Saber (see saber.sa) for conformity.
- *Certificate of Origin*: Needed if origin is on a sticker, not if stamped—gov agencies might still ask. Missing docs? Use a guarantee letter or pay 2000 SAR fine.
- *MSDS*: Batteries need an MSDS—add it for UAE transits to avoid delays.
- *CoC*: Mobiles, computers, and appliances need a lab-tested SASO CoC with the shipment.

Content:
Post Office Boxes
Full address (name, phone, street, building, city) required—no P.O. Boxes.
Duty and Taxes
Include freight and fees in value for duties/taxes.
Clearance Comments
Goods from Pakistan (COO PK) held by Audit Dept—delays vary, no set release time.
Ban of Imports
Pornographic material prohibited.
Payment by Credit Card
Accepted for freight/import charges—check accepted cards with UPS Saudi Arabia.
Miscellaneous
E-commerce (B2C) invoices need a breakdown (value, shipping, duties, VAT, fees)—unnotified charges revert to shipper.
Info About Section Header: This section provides details on the rules and processes for getting shipments through customs in Saudi Arabia.
Simplified Form: - *No P.O. Boxes*: Give full address (name, mobile, street, city)—P.O. Boxes delay delivery.
- *Duty & Tax*: Add shipping fees to item value for calculations.
- *Pakistan Goods*: Items from Pakistan face audit holds—delays can be 1-2 weeks or more.
- *Porn Ban*: No adult material allowed.
- *Pay by Card*: Use credit cards for fees at delivery—confirm cards with UPS Saudi Arabia.
- *E-commerce*: List all charges (value, shipping, duties, VAT) on B2C invoices, or they’ll bill back to shipper.

Content:
Service to every address in Saudi Arabia.
Full address required—no P.O. Boxes.
Rest Days: Friday (UPS), Friday-Saturday (public/private sectors).
GMT: +0300
Language: Arabic
Currency: Saudi Riyal (SAR)
Info About Section Header: This section lists the locations where shipping services are available in Saudi Arabia, along with time zones and holidays.
Simplified Form: - *Nationwide*: UPS delivers everywhere in Saudi Arabia.
- *Full Address*: Include name, phone, street—no P.O. Boxes.
- *Rest Days*: UPS off Friday; most businesses off Friday-Saturday.
- *Time Zone*: GMT +0300 year-round.
- *Language & Money*: Arabic spoken; pay in Saudi Riyal (SAR).

Content:
Duties and Taxes
Bill to shipper, receiver, or third party—third-party details needed. Surcharge if billed outside Saudi Arabia.
E-commerce must notify receivers of all charges, or they revert to shipper.
Shipping Charges
Bill to shipper, receiver, or third party—account number required.
Payment Methods
Only shipper can pay by card, check, or cash.
Third-Party Billing
Domestic shipments can’t bill third parties outside Saudi Arabia.
Info About Section Header: This section explains how shipping costs, duties, and taxes can be paid and by whom in Saudi Arabia.
Simplified Form: - *Who Pays*: Duties/taxes to shipper, receiver, or third party—add third-party name and account.
- *Extra Fee*: Billing outside Saudi Arabia adds a surcharge.
- *E-commerce*: Tell receivers all charges upfront, or shipper pays.
- *Shipping Costs*: Bill to shipper, receiver, or third party—needs an account number.
- *Payment*: Only shipper can use card, check, or cash.
- *Third-Party Limit*: Saudi-to-Saudi shipments can’t bill outside the country.

Content:
Cosmetics
Need Ministry of Health check, CoC, production/expiration dates, ingredients in Arabic, and fixed origin.
Jewelry
Precious metals need engraved origin, 18+ carat gold, purity details, consignee logo—religious symbols banned.
Telecommunication Equipment
Requires import license and CoC.
Computers
Need CoC.
Clothing
Origin on internal labels; military uniforms may need a license—religious symbols banned.
Drugs/Medicine
Private imports banned; needs Health Authority cert or permit from MOH/SFDA—small shipments checked at airport, larger ones downtown.
Animal Products
Non-domesticated need ISC contract; feeds face lab checks.
Food
Subject to Ministry of Health lab analysis.
Info About Section Header: This section lists special rules for shipping certain types of goods to Saudi Arabia.
Simplified Form: - *Cosmetics*: Needs CoC, dates, Arabic ingredients, and permanent origin—lab check possible.
- *Jewelry*: Engrave origin, 18+ carat gold, purity, consignee logo—no religious symbols.
- *Telecom Gear*: Get an import license and CoC.
- *Computers*: Include a CoC.
- *Clothing*: Origin on labels; military uniforms need a license—no religious symbols.
- *Drugs/Medicine*: No private imports—needs origin cert or MOH/SFDA permit; small batches cleared at airport, big ones downtown.
- *Animal Products*: Non-domesticated need ISC; feeds go to lab.
- *Food*: Faces Ministry of Health lab test.

Content: No gift exemption for shipments to Saudi Arabia.
Info About Section Header: This section explains if gifts can avoid taxes or duties in Saudi Arabia.
Simplified Form: - *No Gift Breaks*: All shipments to Saudi Arabia pay full duties and taxes—gifts included.

Content: Non-document shipments need 1 original + 2 copies of invoice on shipper’s letterhead, with full address, phone, and stamp—legalized if over $2,600 USD. Documents don’t need one.
Info About Section Header: This section details what information must be included on an invoice for shipping goods to Saudi Arabia.
Simplified Form: - *Invoice Copies*: Non-documents need 1 original + 2 copies on letterhead with stamp.
- *Details*: List full address, phone—legalize if over $2,600 USD.
- *Documents*: No invoice needed for papers.

Content: Cash letters, airline tickets, passports, etc., count as documents—subject to Ministry of Information inspection.
Info About Section Header: This section lists items treated as documents (not goods) for shipping to Saudi Arabia.
Simplified Form: - *Documents Only*: Tickets, passports, reports—no invoice, but checked by Ministry of Info.
- *Mark It*: Label as 'Documents Only' on waybill.

Content:
Prohibited: Antiques, toys with idols/military/religious symbols, weapons, religious items, Israeli goods, chemicals, tobacco/e-cigarettes, personal effects, artwork, drones, alcohol, narcotics, porn.
Restricted: Perfumes (needs lab check, legalized docs), mobiles (SASO cert), cigars (215% duty + VAT).
Info About Section Header: This section lists items that cannot be shipped to Saudi Arabia or have strict rules.
Simplified Form: - *Banned*: No antiques, military toys, guns, Bibles, Israeli items, chemicals, tobacco, e-cigs, used stuff, art, drones, alcohol, drugs, porn.
- *Perfumes*: Needs lab check, legalized invoice, and origin details.
- *Mobiles*: SASO cert required—unregistered face lab delays.
- *Cigars*: High duty (215%) + 15% VAT on revalued amount.

Content: India to Saudi Arabia: Express Saver, Expedited, Express Freight.
Info About Section Header: This section lists the types of shipping services available from India to Saudi Arabia.
Simplified Form: - *India to Saudi*: Pick Express Saver, Expedited, or Express Freight—check UPS for details.

Content:
Returned Goods
List origin and return reason on invoice.
Repaired Goods
Show value before and after repair.
Samples
Detail and mark/mutilate on invoice.
Solid Wood Packing Material
Follow ISPM 15—needs phytosanitary cert for raw wood over 6mm.
Info About Section Header: This section covers unique rules for returns, repairs, or specific materials to Saudi Arabia.
Simplified Form: - *Returns*: Note origin and why it’s coming back on the invoice.
- *Repairs*: List pre- and post-repair values.
- *Samples*: Describe and mark them unusable on the invoice.
- *Wood Packing*: Raw wood over 6mm needs ISPM 15 cert.

Content: Deminimis: 1000 SAR ($266 USD)—below this, 15% VAT + 17.25 SAR fee; above, 5-20% duty + VAT. Commercial shipments have no deminimis.
Info About Section Header: This section states the minimum value thresholds for shipments that affect taxes or duties in Saudi Arabia.
Simplified Form: - *Low Value*: Up to 1000 SAR ($266 USD)—15% VAT + 17.25 SAR fee.
- *High Value*: Over 1000 SAR—5-20% duty + 15% VAT.
- *Commercial*: No low-value break—duty + VAT on all.

Content:
Max weight: 70 kg (150 lbs.) per package.
Max length: 274 cm (107.9 in.).
Max dimensions: 400 cm (157.5 in.) length and girth combined.
Info About Section Header: This section specifies the maximum weight and size allowed for packages to Saudi Arabia.
Simplified Form: - *Weight Limit*: 70 kg (150 lbs.) max per package.
- *Size Limits*: Max length 274 cm (107.9 in.), total length + girth 400 cm (157.5 in.).
